docs.text: Rom Center Markdown Edition 2023 Use the menu bar at the top to navigate the megathread. Retro games and Arcade games can be found in the Retro Games page . BIOS files can be found in the Miscellaneous page Popular games can be found in the Popular Games page . About Locked Internet Archive Items Internet Archive restricts items that generate a high amount of traffic from being able to be downloaded without an account to prevent abuse. This is shown with a lock icon beside the file name in the item's file listing. When accessing the file directly, the following error is shown instead. To download locked items, register an archive.org account . Additional Information About "No-Intro" and "Redump" No-Intro and Redump are groups that catalog hashes of dumped games for different systems. If a link has "No-Intro" or "Redump" in the name, it is a collection of the currently best-available ROMs for the system. These should be your go-to links if what you are looking for is not in the Popular Games page . About Internet Archive Items Internet Archive items will have metadata files that end in extensions such as .xml and .sqlite . These files are not important to download but are meant for the website to know what files to display and the reviews of the item. About Internet Archive Torrents Some Internet Archive items will contain torrent files to provide another download method. However, the torrent's files listing is usually incomplete compared to what is listed on the website. For this reason, it is recommended to use direct downloads with a download manager instead of torrents. About Archive Files (ZIP, 7z, RAR): These files are not ROMs themselves; to use them, you must extract them. 7-Zip is recommended for extracting these files. Download and install it here and run it. Then, open the archive file in 7-Zip or right click on it and go to 7-Zip -> Extract Files . About uBlock Origin While not required anymore due to megaup links being removed, uBlock Origin is recommended when accessing certain links on this megathread and the Internet in general. It blocks ads, trackers,and much more. Below are links to download and install it for popular web browsers. Store Name Links Chrome Web Store Link Firefox Add-ons Link Opera Add-ons Link For Android: Download Firefox from the Play Store, locate the Addons menu and select uBlock Origin. Add it to Firefox and remember to only use Firefox to download ROMs. How to Bypass Download Limits Google Drive From time to time when trying to download a file, you may see an error message saying “Download quota exceeded, so you can’t download this file at this time”. Here are steps to bypass the download quota limit: Log into your Google account, if you haven’t already. Open Google Drive and go to “My Drive” in the sidebar. Make a new folder in your drive. It doesn’t matter what you name it. Go to the quota'd folder, right click on whatever you want to download, and click “Add Shortcut to Drive”. Navigate to “My Drive” and then to the folder you made, and click “Add Shortcut”. Go to “My Drive” on the sidebar. Right-click the folder you made and click “Download”. A .zip file with the file(s) you selected will start downloading. MEGA and 1Fichier MEGA and 1Fichier have pretty serious data caps and unlike Google Drive, there is no easy way to get around them. To bypass the MEGA and 1Fichier download limits, you will need either a VPN or a list of proxies. For the VPN, connect to it and you are good to go. For a list of proxies, you will have to use some 3rd party tool like JDownloader2 and give it the list of proxies. Do note that this process is fairly advanced. After that, you can start downloading by feeding JDownloader2 links to the files you would like to download.
docs.title: Home
Use the menu bar at the top to navigate the megathread.
Retro games and Arcade games can be found in the Retro Games page.
BIOS files can be found in the Miscellaneous page
Popular games can be found in the Popular Games page.

About Internet Archive Torrents Some Internet Archive items will contain torrent files to provide another download method. However, the torrent's files listing is usually incomplete compared to what is listed on the website. For this reason, it is recommended to use direct downloads with a download manager instead of torrents. docs.text: Google Drive From time to time when trying to download a file, you may see an error message saying “Download quota exceeded, so you can’t download this file at this time”. Here are steps to bypass the download quota limit: Log into your Google account, if you haven’t already. Open Google Drive and go to “My Drive” in the sidebar. Make a new folder in your drive. It doesn’t matter what you name it. Go to the quota'd folder, right click on whatever you want to download, and click “Add Shortcut to Drive”. Navigate to “My Drive” and then to the folder you made, and click “Add Shortcut”. Go to “My Drive” on the sidebar. Right-click the folder you made and click “Download”. A .zip file with the file(s) you selected will start downloading. MEGA and 1Fichier MEGA and 1Fichier have pretty serious data caps and unlike Google Drive, there is no easy way to get around them. To bypass the MEGA and 1Fichier download limits, you will need either a VPN or a list of proxies. For the VPN, connect to it and you are good to go. For a list of proxies, you will have to use some 3rd party tool like JDownloader2 and give it the list of proxies. Do note that this process is fairly advanced. After that, you can start downloading by feeding JDownloader2 links to the files you would like to download.

docs.text: Nintendo Games If you are looking for Retro ROMs, see the Retro Games page . Nintendo DS Myrient (No-Intro) Nintendo - Nintendo DS (Decrypted) Link Nintendo - Nintendo DS (Encrypted) Link Nintendo - Nintendo DS (Download Play) Link Nintendo - Nintendo DSi (Decrypted) Link Nintendo - Nintendo DSi (Encrypted) Link Nintendo - Nintendo DSi (Digital) Link MarioCube Open Directory Internet Archive DSiWare Link Link Internet Archive (No-Intro) Nintendo DS Anti-Piracy Fixed ROMs Link No-Intro Nintendo DS (Decrypted) (2020-01-20) Link No-Intro Nintendo DS (Decrypted) (2021-06-27) Link No-Intro Nintendo DS (Download Play) (2022-07-07) Link No-Intro Nintendo DSi (Decrypted+Encrypted) (2018-06-30) Link Nintendo 3DS hShop 3DS Content in CIA Format Link Myrient (No-Intro) Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Decrypted) Link Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Encrypted) Link Nintendo - New Nintendo 3DS (Decrypted) Link Nintendo - New Nintendo 3DS (Encrypted) Link Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Digital) (Depreciated) Link Nintendo - New Nintendo 3DS (Digital) (Deprecated) Link Unofficial - Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Digital) (Updates and DLC) (Decrypted) Link Unofficial - Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Digital) (Updates and DLC) (Encrypted) Link Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Digital) (CDN) Link Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Digital) (Dev ROMs) Link Nintendo - Nintendo 3DS (Digital) (Pre-Install) Link Internet Archive (No-Intro) No-Intro Nintendo 3DS Encrypted .3ds Part 1 (2021-12-31) Link No-Intro Nintendo 3DS Encrypted .3ds Part 2 (2021-12-31) Link Nintendo 3DS eShop Complete Collection .cia/.3ds Link Nintendo 3DS Complete Collection .3ds [1-1700] Link Nintendo 3DS Complete Collection .3ds [1701-1861] Link No-Intro Nintendo 3DS DLC and Updates Encrypted .cia (2021-10-16) Link 3DS/CIA Decryption Instructions If Citra says the ROM is encrypted, use Batch CIA-3DS Decryptor to decrypt it. If you would like to get a proper No-Intro hash from the converted file, use this script . Or, add the following AES keys to Citra from here . ( backup link ) Click download on Pastebin to download the text in the file as a TXT. Then, follow the installation instructions below for your OS. Windows Installation Instructions Add the downloaded Pastebin TXT file to C:/Users/<your_user_name>/AppData/Roaming/Citra/sysdata and make sure it is named aes_keys.txt . Linux or MacOS Installation Instructions Add the downloaded Pastebin TXT file to ~/.local/share/citra-emu/sysdata and make sure it is named aes_keys.txt . For more information, refer to the Citra Wiki . Nintendo GameCube The RVZ format is recommended for its size and convenience. It works in Dolphin Emulator but not on real hardware. If you are using real hardware, use Dolphin Emulator to convert the files to ISO. (Guide) (Video Guide) Myrient (Redump) (RVZ) Nintendo - GameCube - NKit RVZ [zstd-19-128k] Link Internet Archive (Redump) (RVZ) Gamecube Redump RVZ (USA) Link Gamecube Redump RVZ (EUR) Link Gamecube Redump RVZ (Asia) Link Internet Archive (Redump) (ISO) Gamecube Redump .iso (USA) Part 1 Link Gamecube Redump .iso (USA) Part 2 Link Gamecube Redump .iso (USA) Part 3 Link Gamecube .iso (Japan) Link Gamecube .iso (Europe) Link Gamecube .iso (Oceania) Link Gamecube .iso (Asia) Link Nintendo Wii The RVZ format is recommended for its size and convenience. It works in Dolphin Emulator but not on real hardware. If you are using real hardware, use Dolphin Emulator to convert the files to ISO. (Guide) (Video Guide) Myrient (Redump) (RVZ) Nintendo - Wii - NKit RVZ [zstd-19-128k] Link Internet Archive (Redump) (RVZ) Wii RVZ (USA) Part 1 (# to E) Link Wii RVZ (USA) Part 2 (F to M) Link Wii RVZ (USA) Part 3 (N to S) Link Wii RVZ (USA) Part 4 (T to Z) Link Internet Archive (Redump) (NKit) Wii Redump NKit Part 1 Link Wii Redump NKit Part 2 Link Wii Redump NKit Part 3 Link Wii Redump NKit Part 4 Link Wii Redump NKit Part 5 Link Wii Redump NKit Part 6 Link Wii Redump NKit Part 7 Link Wii Redump NKit Part 8 Link Internet Archive (WBFS) Ghostware Wii Rom Set Part 1 Link Ghostware Wii Rom Set Part 2 Link Ghostware Wii Rom Set Part 3 Link NKit Fully Loaded can be used to convert NKit to ISO, do note that the download is ~14 GB so using RVZ is recommended over NKit. MarioCube Open Directory Internet Archive WiiWare and Virtual Console Link Link Nintendo Wii U WiiUDownloader (NUS) WiiUDownloader Link Note: This is meant to be a replacement for Wii U USB Helper as it is more lightweight and supports Mac and Linux. If for whatever reason you want to install Wii U USB Helper, you can follow this guide . docs.text: NoPayStation is the best and fastest source for PSP, PS3 and PS Vita content. It is a database of games from Sony's CDN along with decryption keys so you can use the files. It is highly recommended that you check NoPayStation before using the links below.
